summary: This is an email from the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to a warden, scheduling a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details logistical arrangements, requests for documents and staff assistance, and outlines a three-day schedule for the review at the institution.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the scheduled 'Psychological Reconstruction' at the correctional institution.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The recipient of the email, responsible for supporting the scheduling and logistics of the psychological reconstruction for inmate Epstein at their institution.

persons.name: Correctional Services Administrator, Northeast Region
persons.context: Will be joining the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator for the psychological reconstruction of inmate Epstein.

persons.name: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the email, organizing and leading the scheduled psychological reconstruction for inmate Epstein, requesting documents and staff assistance from the warden.

connections.description: The Coordinator is corresponding with the Warden to arrange logistics and request support for the psychological reconstruction of inmate Epstein.
The Coordinator states they will be joined by the Administrator for the psychological reconstruction.
The Warden is responsible for the institution where inmate Epstein is held and is being asked to support the review of his case.

events.title: Start of Psychological Reconstruction
events.description: The scheduled psychological reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein begins, with the review team ready for pickup at 0715.

events.title: Completion of Psychological Reconstruction
events.description: The psychological reconstruction for inmate Jeffrey Epstein is expected to be completed by close of business.

locations: The institution (unnamed correctional facility where Epstein is held)
keyFacts: A 'Psychological Reconstruction' was scheduled for inmate Jeffrey Epstein to begin on August 13, 2019, just two days after this email was sent on August 12, 2019.
The review was a multi-day process involving the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator and a Correctional Services Administrator, indicating a high-level internal BOP review.
The email explicitly mentions organizing and facilitating staff interviews as a time-consuming part of the process, suggesting an investigation into institutional conduct or circumstances.
The timing of this scheduled review is highly significant, as Jeffrey Epstein died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, two days *before* this email was sent.
The document reveals post-mortem bureaucratic processes were initiated, including gathering materials and scheduling staff interviews, following Epstein's death.
